text: {| |} USCGC Alert (WMEC-630) is a United States Coast Guard medium endurance cutter and is the last medium endurance cutter constructed. The keel was laid on 5 January 1968 at the United States Coast Guard Yard at Curtis Bay, Maryland, and she was commissioned on Coast Guard Day, 4 August 1969. Alert derives her name from the early 19th century revenue cutter , which served in the early days of the Revenue Cutter Service. ==External links== *Alert home page USCGC Alert (WMEC-630) USCGC Alert (WMEC-630) Category:Reliance-class cutters Alert (WMEC-630) Category:Ships built in Baltimore Category:1969 ships
title: USCGC Alert (WMEC-630)
